bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part, former Act means the Family Relations Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 128, as it read immediately before its repeal by this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — care of and time with children

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an agreement or order, made before the coming into force of this section, provides a party with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: custody or guardianship of a child, the party is a guardian of the child under this Act and has parental responsibilities and parenting time with respect to the child under this Act, or
access to, but not custody or guardianship of, a child, the party has contact with the child under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a party's parental responsibilities, parenting time or contact with a child under this Act are as described in the agreement or order respecting custody, guardianship and access.
This section applies despite the repeal of the former Act and the enactment of Part 5 [Property Division] of this Act.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a proceeding to enforce, set aside or replace an agreement respecting property division made before the coming into force of this section, or
a proceeding respecting property division started under the former Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: must be started or continued, as applicable, under the former Act as if the former Act had not been repealed.
If a spouse became a limited member under the former Act but benefits have not been divided as of the date Part 6 of this Act comes into force, Part 6 of this Act applies to the division of benefits.
If forms prescribed under the former Act are delivered to an administrator after Part 6 of this Act comes into force, the administrator may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: accept the forms as compliance with the requirements of Part 6 of this Act, or
require the parties to give notice in accordance with section 136 [notice or waiver] of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — changing, suspending or terminating orders
bcl:section.bcl:text: For greater certainty, the coming into force of this Act is not in itself a change in circumstances for the purposes of any section of this Act in relation to the changing, suspending or terminating of orders.
An order made under section 37, 38, 124 or 126 of the former Act continues in force in accordance with the terms of the order.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary or advisable for the orderly transition from the former Act to this Act.

The authority to make or amend a regulation made under subsection (1), but not the authority to repeal a regulation made under subsection (1), ends 3 years after the date on which subsection (1) comes into force.
